Compute investment growth with annuities for a variety of annual return rates

annuity_n_returns.Rd

This function takes an initial investment amount, an amount for annuities added to the investment every year, a vector of annual return rates, and years of investment, and returns an interactive plot displaying the performance of the various return rates over the specified period, as well as a tibble with the data displayed in the plot.

Usage

annuity_n_returns(
  initial_investment,
  annuity,
  years,
  return_rates = c(0.06, 0.07, 0.08, 0.09, 0.1)
)

Arguments

initial_investment

A numeric representing the initial investment amount.

annuity

A numeric representing the amount added to the investment every year.

years

A numeric representing the number of years of the investment period.

return_rates

A numeric vector representing the specified annual return rates.

Value

A list with: 1) a plotly plot object displaying the growth curves of the various investments, and 2) a tibble containing the data displayed in the plot.

Examples

# How do 6%, 7%, 8%, 9%, and 10% annual return rates compare after ...
# ... 25 years of an initial $20,000 investment, & $10,000 annual contributions?
list_data_and_plot <- annuity_n_returns(
 20000,
 10000,
 25,
 c(.06,.07,.08,.09,.1)
)

list_data_and_plot[[1]]
